content: free breakfast by emily philp who doesn t love a free breakfast especially when it s waffles this hat is a classic topper for everyone in the family the long folded brim keeps the ears warm while the waffle pattern keeps the needles clicking away this hat was knit using a sport weight yarn but dk would work just as well the pattern provides stitch counts for three sizes baby child adult depending on gauge or preference size can be increased even further by adding 16 stitches to the cast on if making the baby size i recommend using the longer circular cord for magic loop or double pointed needles time to dive into that stash or happily visit your lys sport weight dk fingering held double or fingering held with a mohair all work great this hat is super adaptable to your preference materials yarn 150 225 300 yd 50 75 100 gr sport weight yarn needle size us 4 3 5mm 16 circular needle 40 circular needle for magic loop or double pointed needles for crown decreases tapestry needle accessories stitch markers gauge 12 stitches and 22 row = 2 inches *taken in waffle pattern 12 stitches and 21 row = 2 inches *taken in 1x1 rib pattern abbreviations k- knit stitch p- purl stitch k2tog- knit 2 stitches together 1 stitch decrease bor- beginning of round pm- place marker ktbl- knit through the back of loop getting started cast on 88 104 120 stitches using the long-tail cast on method join to work in the round and place bor marker brim this is a fairly long 1x1 ribbed brim designed to be folded it can be knit in two ways the normal rib or a twisted rib which can look a little bit sharper both directions are below choose one based on your preference round 1 k1 p1 repeat to end of round -or- round 1 twisted ktbl 1 p1 repeat to end of round continue repeating round 1 until the brim measures 3 3 5 4 inches hat body are you happy that you don t have to switch needles right now i sure was here comes the waffle pattern it is a four round repeat that goes by surprisingly fast round 1 knit the round round 2 knit the round round 3 p2 k2 repeat to end of round round 4 p2 k2 repeat to end of round continue knitting rounds 1-4 until the hat measures 5 7 9 inches from the cast on edge finish on a round 3 we will use round 4 to set up for the the decreases set-up round 4 p2 k2 placing a marker after every 22 26 30 stitches there are now 4 equal sections ready for the crown decreases crown decreases i recommend switching to magic loop or double pointed needles whenever it feels more comfortable round 1 * k2tog k to 2 stitches before marker k2tog repeat from * 3 more times round 2 same as
